
::: callout-note
#### More shell keyboard shortcuts

-   Press **<kbd>â‡§</kbd>** to get the previous command back on the prompt, and then
    press **<kbd>Ctrl+U</kbd>** to delete text until the beginning of the line.

-   <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>U</kbd> actually *cuts* the text: "Yank" it back with
    **<kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Y</kbd>**. Press <kbd>Enter</kbd> again.

-   Type `cd` and then space, and then press **<kbd>Alt</kbd>+<kbd>.</kbd>** (or
    **<kbd>Esc</kbd>+<kbd>.</kbd>** on a Mac). That should insert `/fs/ess/PAS2700`
    on the line. In general terms, this keyboard shortcut will insert the last
    word (argument) from the last command line (and you can cycle back by
    pressing it multiple times!).
:::
